title: Analysis Report
code: all_data |>    dplyr::group_by(study) |>    dplyr::reframe(     Language = unique(lang),     N = paste0(       dplyr::n(),        " (", sum(gender == "female"), " F, ", sum(gender == "other"), " O)"     ),     M_age = mean(age, na.rm = TRUE),     SD_age = sd(age, na.rm = TRUE),     min_age = min(age, na.rm = TRUE),     max_age = max(age, na.rm = TRUE),   ) |>    knitr::kable(digits = 2) #> Warning: There were 2 warnings in `dplyr::reframe()`. #> The first warning was: #> ℹ In argument: `min_age = min(age, na.rm = TRUE)`. #> ℹ In group 3: `study = mas`. #> Caused by warning in `min()`: #> ! no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf #> ℹ Run `dplyr::last_dplyr_warnings()` to see the 1 remaining warning. p_counts <-   all_data |>   dplyr::bind_rows(all_data |> dplyr::mutate(study = "total")) |>   dplyr::mutate(     study = factor(       study,        levels = c("burns", "monzel", "mas", "ruby", "kvamme", "total")     )   ) |>    plot_vviq_group_proportions(vviq_group_4, base_size = 12, prop_txt_size = 3)  p_props <-   all_data |>     summarise_aph_and_alexi(vviq_group_4) |>    plot_alexithymia_proportions(     vviq_group_4, ncol = 6,      base_size = 12, prop_txt_size = 2 )  ggpubr::ggarrange(   p_counts, p_props,    ncol = 1,   heights = c(1.1, 1),   labels = "AUTO",   font.label = list(size = 11, face = "bold") )

title: Analysis Report
text: Bayesian models fitted using brms::brm() function brms package (Bürkner, 2017) custom wrapper, fit_brms_model(), sets several default options us. 24000 post-warmup iterations spread across available CPU parallel processing1, 2000 additional warmup iterations per chain. fixed seed used reproducibility. Regularising priors used improve convergence avoid overfitting. weakly informative normal prior mean 0 standard deviation 20 used fixed effects improve default flat priors brms. Default weakly informative priors brms used model parameters. adequacy priors assessed using prior predictive check, presented . avoid refit models time vignette built improve reproducibility, fitted models saved vignettes/models folder loaded R chunks. model fit, checked model performance using posterior predictive checks performance::check_predictions() function ensure models able reproduce data well. tested hypotheses linear models marginal contrasts VVIQ groups. task performed functions marginaleffects package. used marginaleffects::avg_comparisons() function compute contrasts custom report_rope() wrapper (around marginaleffects::posterior_draws(), bayestestR::rope_range() bayestestR::p_direction()) summarise posterior distributions. computed probability direction (PD) contrasts proportions posterior distributions , inside region practical equivalence null (ROPE) (see Makowski et al., 2019). dynamics non-linear models analysed using modelbased::estimate_slopes() function compute variation outcome variable per unit change VVIQ across range. summarised evidence positive negative slopes using custom check_slope_evidence() function computes PD ROPE proportions slope estimates. setup marginaleffects options model priors done chunk . Prior predictive check performed ensure priors set models adequate. done fitting model structure planned analyses sampling prior distributions. posterior predictive distributions prior-model plotted check covered reasonable range values.  go!
code: options("marginaleffects_safe" = FALSE) draws <- seq(1, 4000, 1) # To limit draws that will be used for marginaleffects  priors <- c(brms::prior(normal(0, 20), class = "b")) lm_prior <-    fit_brms_model(     formula = tas ~ vviq_group_4,      data = all_data,     prior = priors,     sample_prior = "only",     file = "models/lm_prior.rds"   )  performance::check_predictions(lm_prior, draw_ids = 1:12) |>    plot() +    ggplot2::labs(title = "Prior Predictive Check") +   theme_pdf(base_size = 12)

title: Analysis Report
code: # Group model lm_tot <-    fit_brms_model(     formula = tas ~ vviq_group_4,      data = all_data,     prior = priors,     file = "models/lm_tot.rds"   )  # Posterior predictive check performance::check_predictions(lm_tot, draw_ids = 1:12) |>    plot() +    theme_pdf(base_size = 12) #> Ignoring unknown labels: #> • size : "" contrasts_tot <-    marginaleffects::comparisons(     lm_tot,     variables = list("vviq_group_4" = "pairwise"),     draw_ids = draws   )  report_rope(contrasts_tot, contrast) |> knitr::kable() p_contr_tot <-    plot_posterior_contrasts(     contrasts_tot, lm_tot,      base_size = 12,     rope_txt = 3,     dot_size = 1,     x_lab = "Effect size (TAS score difference)",     axis_relative_x = 0.7   )  # Group plot p_tot <-    plot_group_violins(     tas ~ vviq_group_4,      y_lab = "Total TAS Score",     base_size = 12   ) +    plot_alexithymia_cutoff(txt_size = 2, txt_x = 1.4, label = "Alexithymia") +   scale_discrete_aphantasia() +   scale_x_aphantasia(add = c(0.4, 0.7))  plot(p_tot + p_contr_tot)

previous_headings: Modelling > Analysis of total TAS-20 scores
title: Analysis Report
code: gam_tot <-    fit_brms_model(     formula = tas ~ s(vviq),      data = all_data,     prior = priors,     file = "models/gam_tot.rds"   )  # Posterior predictive check performance::check_predictions(gam_tot, draw_ids = 1:12) |>    plot() +    theme_pdf(base_size = 12) #> Ignoring unknown labels: #> • size : "" slopes_tot <-   modelbased::estimate_slopes(     gam_tot,      trend = "vviq", by = "vviq", length = 75,     rope_ci = 1   )  check_slope_evidence(slopes_tot) |> knitr::kable() p_slopes_tot <-   plot_gam_slopes(     slopes_tot,     .f_groups = dplyr::case_when(       vviq <= 24 ~ 1,       vviq <= 35 ~ 2,       vviq <= 36 ~ 3,       vviq <= 45 ~ 4,       vviq <= 76 ~ 5,       vviq <= 80 ~ 6     ),     y_lab = "TAS variation per unit change in VVIQ",     base_size = 12   )  p_gam_tot <-   plot_gam_means(     gam_tot,     y_title = "Total TAS score",     legend_relative = 0.85,     base_size = 12   ) +   plot_coloured_subjects(     x = all_data$vviq,      y = all_data$tas,     size = 1   ) +    plot_alexithymia_cutoff(txt_x = 26, label = "Alexithymia") +   scale_discrete_aphantasia() +   scale_x_vviq()   plot(p_gam_tot + p_slopes_tot)

title: Analysis Report
code: # Subscale group models lm_dif <-    fit_brms_model(     formula = tas_identify ~ vviq_group_4,      data = all_data,     prior = priors,     file = "models/lm_dif.rds"   )  lm_ddf <-   fit_brms_model(     formula = tas_describe ~ vviq_group_4,      data = all_data,     prior = priors,     file = "models/lm_ddf.rds"   )  lm_eot <-   fit_brms_model(     formula = tas_external ~ vviq_group_4,     data = all_data,     prior = priors,     file = "models/lm_eot.rds"   )  # Posterior predictive checks pp_dif_lm <-   performance::check_predictions(lm_dif, draw_ids = 1:12) |>    plot() +    theme_pdf(base_size = 12)  pp_ddf_lm <-   performance::check_predictions(lm_ddf, draw_ids = 1:12) |>    plot() +    theme_pdf(base_size = 12)  pp_eot_lm <-   performance::check_predictions(lm_eot, draw_ids = 1:12) |>    plot() +    theme_pdf(base_size = 12)  plot(pp_dif_lm / pp_ddf_lm / pp_eot_lm) #> Ignoring unknown labels: #> • size : "" #> Ignoring unknown labels: #> • size : "" #> Ignoring unknown labels: #> • size : "" contrasts_dif <-    marginaleffects::comparisons(     lm_dif,     variables = list("vviq_group_4" = "pairwise"),     draw_ids = draws   )  report_rope(contrasts_dif, contrast) |> knitr::kable() contrasts_ddf <-   marginaleffects::comparisons(     lm_ddf,     variables = list("vviq_group_4" = "pairwise"),     draw_ids = draws   )  report_rope(contrasts_ddf, contrast) |> knitr::kable() contrasts_eot <-   marginaleffects::comparisons(     lm_eot,     variables = list("vviq_group_4" = "pairwise"),     draw_ids = draws   )  report_rope(contrasts_eot, contrast) |> knitr::kable() # Subscale group plots p_dif <-    plot_group_violins(     tas_identify ~ vviq_group_4,      y_lab = "TAS DIF Score",     base_size = 12   ) +   scale_discrete_aphantasia() +   scale_x_aphantasia(add = c(0.4, 0.7)) p_ddf <-    plot_group_violins(     tas_describe ~ vviq_group_4,      y_lab = "TAS DDF Score",     base_size = 12   ) +   scale_discrete_aphantasia() +   scale_x_aphantasia(add = c(0.4, 0.7)) p_eot <-    plot_group_violins(     tas_external ~ vviq_group_4,      y_lab = "TAS EOT Score",     base_size = 12   ) +   scale_discrete_aphantasia() +   scale_x_aphantasia(add = c(0.4, 0.7))  # Subscale contrast plots p_dif_contr <-    plot_posterior_contrasts(     contrasts_dif, lm_dif,     xlab = "Effect size (DIF score difference)",      base_size = 12,     dot_size = 1,     axis_relative_x = 0.7   ) p_ddf_contr <-    plot_posterior_contrasts(     contrasts_ddf, lm_ddf,     xlab = "Effect size (DDF score difference)",      base_size = 12,     dot_size = 1,     axis_relative_x = 0.7   ) p_eot_contr <-    plot_posterior_contrasts(     contrasts_eot, lm_eot,     xlab = "Effect size (EOT score difference)",      base_size = 12,     dot_size = 1,     axis_relative_x = 0.7   )  ((p_dif + p_dif_contr) + plot_layout(tag_level = "new")) /    ((p_ddf + p_ddf_contr) + plot_layout(tag_level = "new")) /    ((p_eot + p_eot_contr) + plot_layout(tag_level = "new")) +    plot_annotation(tag_levels = c("A", "1")) &   ggplot2::theme(plot.tag = ggplot2::element_text(size = 10, face = "bold"))

what: VVIQ and TAS data from various studies — all_data
title: VVIQ and TAS data from various studies — all_data
text: dataset contains responses Vividness Visual Imagery Questionnaire (VVIQ) Toronto Alexithymia Scale (TAS) collected across various studies. contains following: study: study data originates (see source ) lang: language study (English French) id: unique identifier participant sex gender (distinct sex) age vviq: total score VVIQ tas: total score TAS tas_identify: Difficulty Identifying Feelings (DIF) subscale tas_describe: Difficulty Describing Feelings (DDF) subscale tas_external: Externally Oriented Thinking (EOT) subscale tas_group: categorical variable indicating alexithymia status (alexithymic non-alexithymic) vviq_group_4: categorical variable indicating VVIQ group 4 levels (aphantasia, hypophantasia, typical, hyperphantasia) vviq_group_3: categorical variable indicating VVIQ group 3 levels (aphantasia, hypophantasia, typical/hyperphantasia) vviq_group_2: categorical variable indicating VVIQ group 2 levels (aphantasia/hypophantasia, typical/hyperphantasia) items: nested list-column individual VVIQ TAS item responses available other_data: nested list-column questionnaire data collected studies used current analyses

title: Plot GAM estimated slopes — plot_gam_slopes
text: function creates plot estimated slopes Generalized Additive Model (GAM) using modelbased package. visualizes estimated slopes along confidence intervals categorizes based whether 95% credible intervals exclude zero. Note case Bayesian models used (whole project), modelbased package create ".groups" column correctly GAM objects, user must provide custom grouping function via .f_groups argument categorize slopes appropriately. check_slope_evidence() function can used inspect slope data determine suitable thresholds categorization.

what: Theme for elegant scientific vector figures — theme_pdf
title: Theme for elegant scientific vector figures — theme_pdf
text: function creates ggplot2 theme based guidelines Nature Branded Research Journals. takes default ggplot2 theme argument applies mostly size adjustments text elements. option use custom fonts Google Fonts also built-, chosen default "Montserrat". recommended NRJ, base text size set 7pt text sizes inferior 7pt. exception defaults title size, used journal figures anyway. rest theme designed make figures look good confined restricted spaces (88mm width one column 180mm two columns).

title: Theme for elegant scientific vector figures — theme_pdf
code: theme_pdf(   base_theme = ggplot2::theme_classic,   family = "Montserrat",   base_size = 7,   base_line = 0.2,   title_hjust = 0.5,   axis_relative_size = 0.85,   axis_relative_x = 1,   axis_relative_y = 1,   legend_relative = 1,   ... )

title: Theme for elegant scientific vector figures — theme_pdf
text: base_theme ggplot2 theme function, without parentheses quotes. default ggplot2::theme_classic. family string name font family used theme. found sysfonts::font_add_google(), font reset default "sans" font (close Arial). base_size numeric value base font size points. default 7pt, recommended NRJ. base_line numeric value base line size points. default 0.2pt look good small vector figures. title_hjust numeric value horizontal justification plot title subtitle. default 0.5, centers title. axis_relative_size numeric value relative size axis text compared base size. default 0.85, slightly smaller base size. axis_relative_x, axis_relative_y numeric value relative size x/y-axis text compared axis text size (already depends base size). arguments allow dissociate size x y axes' texts. defaults 1. legend_relative numeric value relative size legend text compared base size. default 1. ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::theme() (can override defaults set ).

title: Theme for elegant scientific vector figures — theme_pdf
text: ggplot2 theme object specified settings.

title: Theme for elegant scientific vector figures — theme_pdf
code: p <-   iris |>   dplyr::mutate(Species = stringr::str_to_title(Species)) |>   ggplot2::ggplot(     ggplot2::aes(       x = Sepal.Length,       y = Sepal.Width,       color = Species,       fill  = Species,       size = Petal.Width    )  ) +  ggplot2::geom_jitter(alpha = 0.5) +  ggplot2::labs(   title    = "Iris Dataset",   subtitle = "A classic dataset for testing",   caption  = "Source: R's built-in iris dataset",   x = "Sepal Length (cm)",   y = "Sepal Width (cm)"  ) +  ggplot2::scale_color_manual(   values = palette.colors(palette = "Okabe-Ito")[c(1, 2, 3)]  ) +  ggplot2::scale_size_continuous(range = c(1, 2.5))   p +   ggplot2::facet_wrap(~ Species) +   theme_pdf(ggplot2::theme_bw, base_size = 12)    p + theme_pdf(   family = "Roboto Slab",   base_size = 12,   legend.position = "right"  )
